content.question: The concentration of a certain element in the water supply of a town is modeled by the function <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="f of t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is measured in parts per billion and <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is measured in years. The first derivative of <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is given by <math alttext="f prime of t, equals, 1 minus the natural log of t, minus sine t " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. At what times <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, for <math alttext="0 less than t, less than 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, does the concentration attain a local minimum?

choices.label: <math alttext="t equals, 1.110 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1.110</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="t equals, 3.353" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3.353</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 5.4: Using the First Derivative Test to Determine Relative (Local) Extrema

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
